availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John R. Fleming (Caldwell / Lyon county, farmer, 1st lieut. 20th Ky Inf)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Married to Isabella A. Peake Fleming in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1854. Father of Frances A. Fleming and Ida E. Fleming. Laborer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Lyon County in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant from January 6, 1862, to January 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 336B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 695.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546372, p. 167.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0329.
"John R. Fleming (1830-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial #131967105, accessed September 8, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/131967105.
